title: Enhancing Customer Service Practical Competencies: Embodied Cognitive Pedagogy for Inclusive Instructional Design

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Service/Customer Engagement Role-Specific Competency Development Program

learning_goals: Learners can design customized learning activities for students with ADHD, ASD, and SLD using embodied cognition theory (3E Framework).

Learners design one multimodal learning module integrating visual, auditory, and tactile elements using smartphone-based tools (Canva, CapCut, etc.) and low-cost technologies (AR/VR kits, IoT sensors, etc.), achieving an 80+/100 suitability score through peer evaluation and expert review.
Learners can analyze learning barriers in practical educational contexts and propose improvements by applying inclusive educational design principles (SpEED Model).
Experiencing a collaborative process to verify the effectiveness of instructional design solutions through peer evaluation and iterative prototyping.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
